A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: OG Star Wars fanboy here\, born with the first film in 1977.  My first memory is seeing Empire in the theater on my 3rd birthday. And I also have read much of what many consider to be \"canon\" novels in the series\, and especially loved the first new canon trilogy focused on Thrawn.  I loved this movie. It was irreverant\, threw much of the \"taking itself too seriously\" ilk out\, and brought the audience more surprises\, feints\, and shear sci-fi action and humor than I was expecting.  Derivative? Hardly. It more likely burned down the self-importance of many self proclaimed Star Wars experts\, like so many sacred Jedi texts.  Well done.  I can't wait for the trilogy finale\, now that we are unburdened of the weight of the past!
